messages.message:
Minor UI nit (this is an old thing; just decided I should comment now):

On the left menu, under "organization", the org-name is repeated from the context switcher in the top nav. If I click on that menu item, it shows me groups & members. Can we rename this menu item "Members & Groups" instead? I think it's confusing the way it's named now.
@Siya + @jack.robbins not sure if this is part of the redesign but feedback to consider
It looks like more of a general nav item (@tj.serkes) - the redesign is focused on app-related flows.
yea, agreed. I can go change it now if we are okay with it
makes sense to me! cc @Rosie for review
Seems like a usability win to me too ◡̈
OK. So when groups is enabled, we'll say "Members & Groups", otherwise we'll use "Members". (groups will be GA'ed in this release.)
@Siya should we use a different icon for "members & groups", maybe the "group" icon?

Ok, I used the "group" icon for now, bc I think it's inconsistent that the "space" icon is used to indicate org on the top nav but the org members & groups in the side nav. Siya, lmk if we should change it back.
https://github.com/instabase/instabase/pull/62272

the group icon works well! i see what you are saying about parity w the workspaces icon; but the organization is being represented here as a header and everything under relates to the org.

the only reason to use the org icon would be to promote consistency [association w org], esp because we don't allow org logos yet and top nav will have the org icon. but the argument above is enough for it to be two different cases.
